laboratory_examinations.findings: All 17 patients had functional visual fields; 13 of 17 patients had optic nerve-visual field mismatch showing no atrophic disc changes. Four patients showed evidence of optic nerve pallor or gliosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At final visits, 8 of 11 patients with initial FVL had stabilization of their examination results. Only 1 patient showed improvement, while 2 patients' findings worsened. The 6 patients who developed FVL later had stable or improved functional findings at their last visit.

laboratory_examinations.findings: All patients exhibited functional visual field defects; patterns included tubular fields in 14 of 17 patients (82%) and nonphysiologic constriction in 12 of 17 patients (71%).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Most patients showed stabilization in visual field findings, although 2 patients had progressive deterioration of their functional fields through their last visit.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Decreased visual acuity (VA) was noted in 6 patients, with fluctuating results based on effort and examination technique.
Functional field defects identified; many patients showed features consistent with FVL.
Functional visual fields exhibited, with patterns indicating nonorganic loss.
6 of 17 patients had fluctuating (inconsistent) visual acuity without examination change.
